channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wrong turn leads to hundreds of immigrant arrests at the Detroit-Canada border bridge
item.description: NPR has for months been receiving tips about detentions at the Ambassador Bridge in Michigan. An inquiry by Representative Rashida Tlaib, a Michigan D...

item.title: Fyre Festival's embattled founder is selling the brand: 'It's time to pass the torch'
item.description: Billy McFarland says he will sell the brand "to an operator that can fully realize its vision." The news comes days after the postponement of Fyre Fes...

item.title: How to get older men to socialize is a puzzle. A group called ROMEO is one answer
item.description: ROMEO stands for "retired older men eating out," and it's helping guys in one Maine town get out of the house and into more friendships.

item.title: House oversight committee demands answers on gutting of CDC public records office
item.description: House Rep. Gerry Connolly is pushing CDC leadership to explain why the personnel who handle FOIA requests lost their jobs, noting that that the public...

item.title: Mercury, Venus and Saturn to delight stargazers in a parade across the sky
item.description: The pre-dawn sky will feature a glowing crescent moon, joined by planets Mercury, Venus and Saturn.

item.title: Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump’s push to end DEI in K-12 public schools
item.description: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration’s guidance forbidding diversity, equity and inclusion efforts in K-12 public schools.

item.title: Benin admits that 54 soldiers killed in attack by al-Qaeda group
item.description: This is the deadliest known attack since insurgents began operating in Benin at the beginning of the decade.

item.title: Trump asks Supreme Court to let him enforce transgender military ban
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order that directed the Pentagon to develop a policy that would bar transgender people from serving in the militar...

item.title: Venezuelan man in Detroit deported after wrong turn at Ambassador Bridge
item.description: A 32-year-old Venezuelan man reportedly took a wrong turn onto the Ambassador Bridge, crossing into Canada, while delivering food back in January, and...

item.title: Most Americans expect higher prices as a result of Trump’s tariffs, a new AP-NORC poll finds
Could this be the end of the road for Tanzania's great survivor?
item.description: Tundu Lissu has survived against the political odds over the years but has now been charged with treason.

item.title: Apr 24: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: At least eight killed and dozens wounded in Russian attack on Ukrainian capital; Risers and fallers to watch in the 2025 NFL draft.

item.title: From banning tech to ending sister-city ties, US states have at least 240 anti-China proposals
Trump says he is 'not happy' with deadly Russian strikes on Kyiv
item.description: The overnight strikes killed at least eight people and injured 77 more, local officials have said.

item.title: South Africa and Ukraine woo each other - as relationships with Trump turn sour
item.description: Volodymyr Zelensky ends an historic visit to South Africa to counter Russia's influence on the continent.

item.title: Pakistan suspends visas for Indians after deadly Kashmir attack on tourists
item.description: It comes after Delhi's retaliatory measures following a militant attack in Indian-administered Kashmir that killed 26 tourists.

item.title: Trump "not happy" with Russian strikes on Kyiv: "Vladimir, STOP!"
item.description: President Trump called Thursday's strikes "very bad timing," as he wants Russia and Ukraine to reach a peace deal.

item.title: Gunmen torch vehicles across Mexico as cartel turf war rages
item.description: The Jalisco New Generation cartel was designated a terrorist organization by U.S. President Donald Trump in February.
